For Lucifer ’ s sake , are you off your nut ? <newline> <newline> Finn : I don ’ t think it ’ s that crazy , there aren ’ t that many of them and ever since the 20th century came around and people started getting more civilized there have been way less of them coming in… <newline> <newline> Rafael : There is no room for argument . This is a directive from our Father . <newline> <newline> Zaturick : But – <newline> <newline> Rafael : This meeting is over . <newline> <newline> *Rafael and Finn dematerialize . * <newline> <newline> Zaturick : The boss is going to be so pissed… . <newline> <newline> *Zaturick dematerializes . * <newline> <newline> <newline>

prompt: Satan faces the issues of being a single parent to the babies and children sacrificed to him
story:
**The Weight of the Damned**

In the depths of the underworld, a lone figure sat amidst the shadows, his piercing eyes fixed on a stack of letters and photographs. Lucifer, the Morning Star, the Bringer of Light, the Lord of Darkness – he was known to all as Satan, the embodiment of evil. Yet, as he gazed upon the scattered pages, a sense of desperation crept into his voice.

"How can I provide for them?" he whispered to the empty air. "How can I give them the life they deserve when I'm the one who took it from them in the first place?"

Before him lay a collection of letters from the children he had claimed as his own, the ones he had sacrificed to the fires of hell. There was Emily, the little girl with the bright smile and sparkling eyes, who had been taken from her family on her fifth birthday. Then there was Jack, the rambunctious boy who had been snatched from his bed on his tenth night, leaving behind a family shattered and a mother's tears.

As Lucifer delved deeper into the letters, he discovered that his children were growing up without the love and care of their families. They were being raised by the demons, taught to fear and obey, but never to love or be loved in return. The weight of his guilt was crushing him, and for the first time in eons, he felt the sting of loneliness.

He thought back to the day he had made the pact with humanity, trading his own soul for power and control. He had never intended for this to be the cost, but as the years went by, he realized that his children were the ones who suffered the most. They were the innocent victims of his own ambition, and he was the one who had to live with the consequences.

Lucifer's eyes fell upon a photograph of a young girl, no more than ten years old, with a look of sadness etched on her face. He had named her Aria, and she had been the first of his children to be taken from her family. He remembered the day vividly, the sound of her mother's screams, the feeling of his own heart turning to stone.

As the darkness closed in around him, Lucifer knew he had to make a change. He couldn't keep living with the knowledge of what he had done. He couldn't keep denying his children the love and care they deserved. With a newfound determination, he rose from his throne, his eyes blazing with a fierce inner light.

"I will find a way to make it right," he vowed to the shadows. "I will find a way to give my children the lives they deserve, even if it means giving up my own power and control."

The underworld trembled at the sound of his voice, but Lucifer didn't care. For the first time in centuries, he felt a glimmer of hope, a sense that maybe, just maybe, he could find redemption in the darkness.

prompt: After Earth is destroyed , the surviving humans colonize two different planets . All contact between the two groups was lost , until they rediscover each other thousands of years later .
story: Tartok looked up . There was a falling star , an angel that had displeased Mother Sky . Tartok looked back at the water his narrow canoe was on , murky in the nighttime . He had better get back soon , or he could freeze to death . Water had splashed into his small raft and splattered him with currents of ice . He rowed back to shore , where his son Alrak , almost taller than his mother , who was much taller than Tartok , was waiting . He had the hounds tied up , ready to get loose and bring the man and his son back to their home . <newline> <newline> `` Alrak , '' Tartok said . `` Did you feed them ? '' <newline> <newline> `` No , '' Alrak said , short and sweet , the way his strict father demanded . <newline> <newline> `` Give them one fish to split between them . When we get home they will have one half buffalo steak each . These dogs worked hard today , bringing us all the way out here . '' <newline> <newline> `` Yes sir , '' Alrak said , quickly picking up a small fish and plopping it in front of the dogs . They bit into it ravenously , having not been fed all day . The rest of the fish would feed Tartok , his wife , his two sons , and his three daughters all week . While he and Alrak , the second-born of all seven children , were out hunting , his daughters were at home learning to cook , clean , and comfort by their mother , who was a master of all three . The youngest of the seven , Tartok 's second son was probably asleep . He would be taught to hunt tomorrow by his father and his brother . They had a plentiful fish harvest this week and would not need to come back . Sometimes these trips only sufficed enough food to feed them for half a week , or a day , or sometimes not even that . On the ice caps of Malwrak , the only parts inhabitable , anything could happen . <newline> <newline> As the dogs pulled the heavy sled connected to the canoe ahead and home , Tartok looked up . The falling star was back , but brighter than before . It left a red streak across the sky , and appeared to be headed to the center of the capital of Malwrak , which was much more advanced than here at the very edges of civilization . Tartok wondered what , if anything would happen if the star crashed . <newline> _________________ <newline> Talia mashed at buttons on the console . `` No , no , no ! '' she screamed . The ship could n't crash , not after how far they had come . They had sailed around the sun just to get here , the place people though might , might hold life . Talia , along with Jarak and Syphon had been sent on the ship after years of training . No one knew what the planet would be like ; large or small , hot or cold , high gravity or low gravity . They had trained for every possibility , and had gone through countless simulations of landing , which had to be done manually despite autopilot , but no one thought they could just run out of fuel ! Someone must have emptied some . <newline> <newline> `` Ship diagnostic ! '' she yelled . A sleek feminine voice calmly said , `` Oxygen : 100 % . Crew : 100 % . Weapons : 100 % . Shiel -- '' <newline> <newline> `` Just tell me what 's wrong ! '' Talia screamed . <newline> <newline> The ship paused for a moment before saying , `` Autopilot scrambled . Prepare for landing . '' <newline> <newline> `` No ! There 's nowhere to land ! '' she said , but the ship did not respond . <newline> A door opened behind her and Jarak walked in . <newline> <newline> `` Talia ! '' he said . `` Why are we landing ? There 's only cities beneath us -- '' <newline> <newline> `` *The autopilot is n't working ! * '' she yelled . `` Help me fly this thing ! '' <newline> <newline> Jarak ran forward and sat in the copilot seat . He had been the top of the landing class . He would know what to do . <newline> <newline> He looked out from the screen , showing what was outside the front of the ship despite the cockpit being in the very back . <newline> <newline> `` Um , there 's a field over there , '' he said . He started to steer the ship in the direction he had pointed , away from the towering buildings which seemed to be made of iridescent ice . The ship swerved , knocking into one of the buildings . A crater formed and some ice fell to the street below , but the sleek ship continued on its course . The place they were heading for was about 50 miles away , near the frigid sea that contained the borders of this country . The ship had detected the only life besides plants were at the pole . The city in the middle of the pole certainly proved that . <newline> <newline> They moved quickly towards the icy plain . There was a small cabin below , about two hundred meters from the sharp drop off of a cliff . Suddenly Jarak yelled . <newline> <newline> `` What ? '' Talia asked , panicked . <newline> <newline> `` Ca n't you see ? We 're overshooting the ice ! We 're going to land in the ocean ! '' <newline> <newline> Talia quickly tried to serve the ship , but at the angle they were travelling they had two possible destinations : the ocean , straight ahead , or the wall of a cliff made of ice if they turned . <newline> Talia and Jarak prepped for a water landing . <newline> ________________________ <newline> `` Did you see the falling star ? '' asked Tartok 's wife , Jæra when they had finished their dinner of fish steaks . <newline> <newline> `` Yes , as we were coming home , '' Tartok said bitterly . Alrak had given each dog a whole steak each , not half . They had wasted many steaks and would not be able to eat as plentiful this week , just the fish he had harvested . <newline> <newline> `` Were you hurt ? '' Jæra asked . <newline> <newline> `` No , we are fine . '' Tartok said . Jæra was always worrying . She worried too much , Tartok thought . <newline> <newline> Suddenly they heard a roaring above them , like a bird but sharper , stronger , somehow ... wrong . <newline> <newline> `` What was that ? '' Jæra asked . <newline> <newline> `` I do not know , '' Tartok said . He got up from his chair , one of two in the house , the other occupied by Jæra , and walked to the door . As he pushed it open , a sight unfolded that he could never have imagined . <newline> <newline> A metal bird with fire feet was flying towards the water . It would crash , but there was no other way for it to land without crashing into the cliff and possibly making the cliff fall into the water . Jæra had never wanted to be so close to the water , but Tartok had always said that they were far enough . She may have been right . <newline> <newline> The metal bird was large , large enough to hold Tartok 's entire family and the sleddogs . Suddenly part of its side flew off , and people jumped out . They had packs on their back , and as soon as they were in the air they pulled on a string and fell slowly , down and to the side . Only three jumped out , and the ship continued on its path to the ocean . <newline> <newline> When one of the people landed , Tartok walked up to them . `` What is going on here ? '' he asked . <newline> <newline> The person replied in a language very similar to Tartok 's . They were different , but Tartok could understand snippets . <newline> <newline> `` World ... ship ... first ... talk ... help . '' <newline> <newline> `` What do you need help with ? '' he asked , ready to do whatever he could to help people . He may be small and bittersweet , but Tartok was always ready to help . <newline> ________________________________________ <newline> The man in front of Syphon was speaking in a primal language . Talia hoped that Syphon would be able to understand him . She was sent as a translator , having studied all the languages of their original home , what was called something like `` Terr '' or `` Ert , '' that were remembered . <newline> <newline> `` We were sent to this world , '' she said , `` in that ship . You are the first people of another planet we have ever talked to . Will you help us make peace ? '' she asked in the language they used on their home planet of Lœa . <newline> <newline> The man said something in the primal language , and Syphon told Talia , `` He 's willing to help , but he only partially understands us . Do you have the ICD ? '' Syphon asked . ICD stood for *Interplanetary Communication Device* . <newline> Talia stared at her , wordless . `` I ... I thought you had it , '' she said . <newline> <newline> Syphon 's face went a stark pallor , matching the blue-white ice . `` Jarak ! You have the ICD , right ? '' she asked . <newline> <newline> `` No , '' he said . `` Why ? Do n't one of <newline> you ... Oh shit , you guys forgot it , did n't you ? '' Jarak was not one to cuss unless the situation was dire , which this certainly was . If they could n't find it , they would n't be able to tell the Lœans what they had found ! They 'd be stuck in this icy wilderness for their entire lives ! <newline> <newline> `` Oh , shit shit shit , '' Jarak said . `` Um , it was in the cockpit , right ? '' <newline> <newline> `` Yeah , '' Talia said . `` How did I forget it ? '' she muttered . <newline> <newline> `` Okay , we need to go find it . Ask him if he has rope , '' Jarak said to Syphon . <newline> <newline> Syphon translated the message since the man did n't speak their own language . He replied in the same language , and Syphon said , `` He says he can understand me now and that he does have rope . He 's willing to help us . '' <newline> <newline> `` Tell him to go get the rope , and that we do n't need his help . We can scale the cliff and get it ourselves . '' Jarak said bitterly . <newline> <newline> As Syphon translated , Talia said , `` Why should n't we have his help ? He probably knows the cliff and water better than us , and if we 're going to establish stable connections to this planet we may as well start now . '' <newline> <newline> The man asked something and Syphon replied . He said something again , and Syphon said , `` He says he knows how to scale the cliff and how deep the water is at places . He wants to help . '' <newline> <newline> Jarak sighed . `` Fine , but tell him to hurry . '' <newline> ________________________________________ <newline> Tartok hurried to the shed where the dogs lived , just large enough for all of them and the ropes . He slammed open the door and some of the dogs looked up , bored . He grabbed the rope he used to tie them to the sled . It would be enough to scale the cliff , about fifteen meters ; not very tall unless the bottom is a tide pool of liquid ice with spiky rock at the bottom , poking up randomly . He took it and some of the bones from the dogs ' dinners . He crushed them into a crack in the ice where they held . He stepped on it , and it held him . He slammed another right behind it , trying the same test . If it held him , it would certainly hold the young , bitter man who had escaped the bird . The man was tall but thin , probably weighing a little more than Tartok himself . He tied the rope around the bones and told the translating woman , `` I am ready to go with the man . '' When she tells her crew , she replies , `` The man is not going . The other woman is . '' <newline> <newline> Tartok is shocked . Surely the man is the captain of the crew ? <newline> <newline> It does not matter much . These people are from some far odd land and need help . They have different customs . Tartok is not one to judge . <newline> <newline> `` Okay , '' he says as the translator relays his message . `` Let 's get to work . ''

prompt: After Earth is destroyed , the surviving humans colonize two different planets . All contact between the two groups was lost , until they rediscover each other thousands of years later .
story:
The stars shone like diamonds in the vast expanse of space, a reminder of the infinite possibilities that lay beyond the ravaged remains of Earth. The once blue planet now a barren, lifeless husk, a testament to the devastating consequences of humanity's own destructive nature.

In the aftermath of the cataclysmic event, two groups of survivors had managed to escape the devastation, fleeing to distant planets in search of a new home. The first group, led by the enigmatic and brilliant scientist, Dr. Elara Vex, had settled on a planet known as Nova Terra. The second group, under the leadership of the charismatic and cunning, Captain Jaxon Vash, had established themselves on a planet called Aethereia.

For thousands of years, the two groups lived in isolation, unaware of the existence of the other. They built their own societies, developed their own cultures, and forged their own paths. The memories of their shared past were all but forgotten, lost to the sands of time.

But fate had other plans.

On a fateful day, a lone astronomer on Nova Terra stumbled upon an ancient transmission, hidden deep within the planet's archives. The message was garbled and distorted, but one phrase stood out: "Echo-1, this is Nova Terra. We have been waiting."

The astronomer, a young woman named Aria, was both thrilled and terrified by the discovery. She knew that this message could be the key to unlocking a new era of cooperation and understanding between the two groups.

Aria's findings were met with skepticism by the leaders of Nova Terra, but she refused to give up. She spent years tracking down the source of the transmission, following a trail of cryptic clues and ancient artifacts.

Meanwhile, on Aethereia, Captain Vash had been experiencing strange occurrences. Equipment would malfunction, and strange noises could be heard in the dead of night. He suspected that something was amiss, but he couldn't quite put his finger on what it was.

And then, one day, the transmission arrived.

Aria's voice crackled through the comms system, her words barely intelligible. "Echo-1, this is Nova Terra. We have been waiting. We have been waiting for so long."

Captain Vash's eyes widened as he listened to the message. He felt a shiver run down his spine as he realized that the transmission was not just a message, but a key to unlocking a new era of understanding between the two groups.

The two leaders, Dr. Vex and Captain Vash, met in a neutral location, their faces etched with a mix of emotions. They spoke of their past, of their struggles and triumphs, and of the memories that had been lost to the ages.

As they spoke, the stars shone down on them, a reminder of the infinite possibilities that lay before them. The two groups, once isolated and alone, had finally found each other. A new era of cooperation and understanding had begun, one that would change the course of history forever.

But as they looked out into the vast expanse of space, they knew that they were not alone. There were others out there, waiting to be discovered. And they wondered, what other secrets lay hidden in the stars, waiting to be uncovered?

prompt: Every authority is baffled but for the past few years everyone has been receiving a Christmas present . To some delight and others horror , the gifts are based on how 'good ' you 've been .
story: Despite parents having said it for generations , * '' What did Santa get you ? `` * took on a whole new meaning on Christmas day , 2015 . <newline> <newline> On a day when the TVs around the country were usually playing Christmas songs from the 70 's , they were now fixed on the news channels , all with `` BREAKING NEWS '' banners flashing across the screen . Reports of robberies , with no sign of forced entry and cries over invasion of privacy , yet with no-one quite sure what it was of their privacy that was invaded . The only thing that was crystal clear was that during the night of Christmas eve , someone had entered each person 's home and placed presents under the tree . Not just randomly either . Each present was labeled and each mother , father and child in the home was accounted for . <newline> <newline> It took a while for some to notice , usually the families where the parents teased their children by delaying the gifts promising excitement and joy , but by midday everyone had discovered one extra present per person . Most children received expensive toys or video games and adults sometimes even found a new car parked outside ; keys in the ignition and a green tree hanging from the rear view mirror . <newline> <newline> Not everyone was happy though . Some had woken up on Christmas day to find something entirely different and unpleasant . Liars searched for their present only to find rotten fish , wrapped and pushed under floorboards . Men and women who had cheated on their spouses unwrapped their gifts to find naked action figures ; seemingly innocent enough but when picked up they would begin to reel off intimate details of their affairs while their partner was in the room . Needless to say , it was these very people who were shouting the loudest and writing to their local papers the quickest . <newline> <newline> The government was quick to step in , with the prime minister appearing outside his home in the late afternoon to speak to the nation . He spoke with countless microphones extended towards his face , but managed to keep his eyes on the camera placed dead center . <newline> <newline> * '' Good evening everyone . There does n't seem to be a single family across the nation who has n't been visited by 'Santa ' '' * he began , raising and bending two fingers to emphasize the fictional character . * '' I assure everyone that the government and I are doing our utmost to figure out what is going on , and to determine who is behind all of this . We ask for your patience as we begin our investigation . Please try to enjoy the rest of your Christmas ! `` * Without further comment , the PM waved as he retreated back into his home , where his staff awaited him . <newline> <newline> * '' God dammit , Linda . Find out what is going on ! `` * , the PM demanded as he threw off the reindeer knit his staff insisted he wear . <newline> <newline> Linda replied promptly , following the PM through to his office . * '' Of course , Sir . We have local law enforcement around the country inspecting people 's homes . I 'm not sure what we 're expecting to find though . Could it really be him ? * '' <newline> <newline> The head of the country stopped in his tracks , spun on his heels and stared straight into his assistant 's eyes for several moments without saying a word . Just as she was about to apologize , he stepped towards her , forcing her to step backwards towards the door . <newline> <newline> * '' Listen . I do n't care WHO did it . I do n't care WHY they did it . All I WANT is for the responsible party to be found and for their trespassin ' asses to be nailed to the wall . Am I clear ? `` * <newline> <newline> Linda , who was now half way out into the corridor , apologized profusely and span on her own heels and walked straight into the staff office . The PM adjusted the collar around his neck as he watched her scuttle away , then stormed back into his own office , locking the door behind him . <newline> <newline> He paced up and down the room , the heels of his shoes clicking off the hardwood flooring . He spent some time texting old friends in the police force , asking if they had any leads . When they did n't reply at a moment 's notice he threw his phone against the sofa at the back of the room . He eventually got tired of walking and returned to his desk where he had spent the whole morning before his staff demanded he speak to the press . <newline> <newline> Opening the drawer he pulled out a small box , wrapped in what seemed to be white wrapping paper with thin black lines . Upon closer inspection those lines were actually text from emails which the PM had written . Emails which should n't have seen the light of day . He held the box in his hands for several minutes , not reading what it had been wrapped in as he already knew it was all the information that would end his career . A career built upon bribes , deceit and some things much worse . With a heavy sigh he pushed his thumbs against the lid of the box and let it fall to the floor . <newline> <newline> The inside of the box was also lined with printed emails but in the center sat the hairband which he gave to his daughter the Christmas before he was elected . The daughter who was supposed to be on holiday , but who was now not answering her phone or emails . <newline> <newline> The PM sat at his desk with no holiday cheer around him , knowing that he had received , to put it lightly , the worst Christmas present in the country . Strangely it was n't the present or even his missing child that was haunting him the most . <newline> <newline> It was knowing that he had deserved it . <newline> <newline> -- -- -- - <newline> <newline> First writing prompt attempt ! Enjoy ! <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline>

prompt: Every authority is baffled but for the past few years everyone has been receiving a Christmas present . To some delight and others horror , the gifts are based on how 'good ' you 've been .
story:
It started with a whisper, a rumor that spread like wildfire through the streets. People couldn't believe their ears when they heard the news: every year, on Christmas morning, a mysterious figure would deliver a gift tailored to each individual's behavior. At first, it was dismissed as a prank, a clever marketing stunt gone wrong. But as the years went by, the gifts continued to arrive, and the recipients couldn't deny the eerie accuracy of their contents.

For Emily, a struggling artist, her gift was a set of high-quality paints and brushes, a nod to her dedication to her craft. She beamed with pride, feeling seen and appreciated. Her neighbor, Mr. Jenkins, a gruff but lovable man, received a new pair of slippers, a gift that brought a hint of a smile to his face.

However, not everyone was pleased. Rachel, a high-powered executive, received a book on mindfulness and meditation, a constant reminder of her own shortcomings. She seethed with resentment, feeling like the system was stacked against her. Her coworker, Alex, a charming but entitled young man, got a gift certificate for a community service project, a slap in the face to his entitled attitude.

As the years went by, the gifts continued to arrive, and the world was left to ponder the motivations behind this strange phenomenon. Some saw it as a benevolent gesture, a way to encourage good behavior and reward those who had been good. Others saw it as a sinister plot, a way to control and manipulate individuals.

Governments and institutions tried to get to the bottom of the mystery, but every attempt ended in failure. The gifts seemed to come from nowhere, and the identity of the sender remained a mystery. Some speculated that it was a group of rogue AI, while others believed it was a secret society of benevolent beings.

As Christmas approached, the world held its breath, wondering what gifts they would receive. Would it be a token of appreciation or a reminder of their shortcomings? The uncertainty was palpable, and people went about their daily lives with a mix of excitement and trepidation.

On Christmas morning, the gifts arrived, and the world was left to ponder the meaning behind them. For some, it was a welcome surprise, a reminder of their good deeds. For others, it was a source of anxiety, a constant reminder of their flaws. As the day went on, the world slowly came to terms with the gifts, and the mystery of their sender remained a secret, known only to the mysterious figure who delivered them.

In the end, the gifts became a part of the holiday tradition, a strange and wonderful ritual that brought people together. They were a reminder that even in a world of chaos and uncertainty, there was still room for kindness and generosity. And as the years went by, the world learned to accept the gifts, and the mysterious figure who delivered them, as a part of the fabric of their lives.

prompt: What 's on the tape ?
story: `` Is that it ? '' He sighed . `` Yeah . I hate watching these . '' `` It 's necessary . We have to know . '' Bob pushed the tape into the TV/VCR player that was all the department could afford . Up on the screen appeared a little boy , about three , clutching a teddy bear . `` Do n't . Please , not again ! '' The close ups were the worst . He reviewed it all . `` We have it . It 's all we need . '' Another day , another perp . One day , one day , we wo n't have to do this any more , thought Bob . If the medicine works , we 'll never have to do this again . He sighed , and for the last time , picked up the phone . `` Pick him up . He 's ours . '' The last man to be arrested for that hideous crime would be the first treated with the new cure .

prompt: What 's on the tape ?
story:
**The Unseen Message**

Detective Jameson stared at the old VHS tape, his mind racing with possibilities. It had been sent to him anonymously, with no return address and no explanation. The only clue was a small note attached to the tape: "What's on the tape?"

He had played it once before, but the grainy footage had been too distorted to make out anything. Now, he had a new player, a high-tech device that promised to improve the quality. He inserted the tape, and the machine whirred to life.

The footage began, and Jameson's eyes scanned the scene. It was a typical suburban street, with houses and trees lining the sidewalk. But then, something caught his attention. A figure, partially hidden by a bush, was watching the camera.

Jameson's heart quickened as he realized that the figure was moving, its eyes fixed on the camera. The image began to blur, and Jameson's stomach dropped. The figure was now standing in front of the camera, its face twisted in a snarl.

Suddenly, the image went black.

Jameson rewound the tape, his mind reeling with questions. Who was the figure? What did it want? And why was it watching him?

He played the tape again, this time paying closer attention to the figure. It was a woman, her face obscured by a hoodie. But as she moved, Jameson caught a glimpse of her hand, holding a small object.

The tape went black again, and Jameson was left with more questions than answers. He decided to investigate further, scouring the neighborhood for any clues.

As he walked down the street, he noticed a small, almost imperceptible symbol etched into the side of one of the houses. It looked like a cross between a hieroglyph and a mathematical equation.

Jameson's eyes widened as he realized that the symbol was a code. He quickly pulled out his phone and snapped a photo of the symbol, hoping to decipher its meaning.

The next few hours were a blur of research and analysis. Jameson pored over books on cryptography and coding, but the symbol remained a mystery.

Just as he was about to give up, he received a text message from an unknown number: "Look again at the tape."

Jameson's heart skipped a beat as he realized that the message was from the same person who had sent him the tape. He rewound the footage once more, this time paying attention to the small object the woman had been holding.

As the image stabilized, Jameson saw that it was a small, silver key. The key was attached to a leather strap, and as the woman moved, the strap glinted in the sunlight.

Jameson's eyes widened as he realized that the key was the answer to the mystery. It was a key to a safe, hidden somewhere in the neighborhood. And as he looked around, he spotted a small, unassuming safe hidden behind a bush.

With shaking hands, Jameson opened the safe and found a note inside. It was from the woman, and it read: "What's on the tape is just the beginning. Look for the truth in the shadows."

Jameson's mind reeled as he realized that the mystery was far from over. The woman had left him a trail of clues, but the ultimate truth remained hidden, waiting to be uncovered.

prompt: Write a story that is perfectly normal , until the last line .
story: `` Aw , do n't cry my sweet little girl ! You were so quiet earlier , even with all the racket my friends made ! '' <newline> Shrill screams and crocodile tears stream from her face , unrelenting . She 's heavy . <newline> `` Oh do you have a full poopie bag ? Is that why you 're crying ? I might just have to take care of this before I can finish cleaning the living room . Such a poopie monster , are n't you . '' <newline> `` Now , where did your mommy put those clean poo holders ? '' <newline> He rummages through the shelves . Empty bottles and bottle caps . He grabs the wet naps and baby powder then turns to the closet nearby . <newline> `` There they are . Do n't worry sweet thing , you 'll be clean and tidy before you know it . I 'm a cleaner by trade , and I 'm the best . '' <newline> He sets her on the changing table and begins his dirty work . Tossing out the old diaper . Grabbing a fresh wet one and tidying up the tiny butt cheeks , covered in muck . A dash of baby powder . prompt: Write a story that is perfectly normal , until the last line .
story:
It was a typical Wednesday morning for John. He woke up at 6:00 AM, got dressed in his usual attire, and headed to the kitchen to start his day with a cup of coffee. As he waited for the coffee to brew, he checked his phone for any important notifications. There were a few texts from his friends, but nothing that required his immediate attention.

After finishing his coffee, John headed to the office, where he worked as an accountant. The day was uneventful, with most of his tasks being routine and mundane. He spent the morning reviewing financial reports, attending meetings, and answering phone calls.

At lunchtime, John met up with his colleagues at a nearby café. They chatted about their weekends and shared stories about their families. The conversation was light and friendly, and John felt grateful to have such a supportive work environment.

The afternoon was more of the same, with John working on a few projects and taking short breaks to stretch his legs. As the day drew to a close, he packed up his things and headed home.

As he walked through the front door, John was greeted by the warm smile of his wife, Sarah. She had made his favorite dinner, chicken parmesan, and the aroma filled the entire house. John felt a sense of contentment wash over him as he realized that he had a loving family and a comfortable home.

As he sat down to eat dinner, John couldn't help but think about how lucky he was. He had a good job, a loving wife, and a beautiful home. He felt grateful for all the blessings in his life and made a mental note to appreciate them more.

As he finished his dinner and began to clear the table, John's wife, Sarah, walked into the kitchen and handed him a small package. "I got you something," she said with a smile. John unwrapped the package to reveal a small, intricately carved wooden box.

"What is it?" John asked, his curiosity piqued.

"It's a box," Sarah replied, her eyes sparkling with mischief. "Open it."

John's eyes widened as he lifted the lid, revealing a small, glowing portal. The air around him began to distort and ripple, and John felt himself being pulled towards the portal. As he peered into its depths, he saw a swirling vortex of colors and lights, and his world went dark.

And then, everything went black.

prompt: Even with all the stars on the sky , the night will always remain dark .
story: The feast had been going on for days but there was no end in sight . It was not just the celebration of two people joining each other for a lifetime of happiness , it was four decades of constant warfare coming to an end . <newline> <newline> What started as a feud between to minor leudes escalated to the most terrible war the kingdoms had seen since the dawn of men . Fourty years of murder , rape and pillaging had devastated the land and the people alike , yet the table was richly set and the wine was flowing like the blood of those who had given their life for this peace . <newline> <newline> The marriage of Emperor Aldwyn II , Lordprotecter of the realm and Earl of the Lowlands to Winifred of Princess of the mountain peak , Lady of the narrow county was truly an event to be celebrated . Aldwyn had been sceptical of his bride . He was a young man and not a too bad looking one at that . His uncle had arranged this marriage before his death as part of a peace agreement between the two kingdoms . And he was happy about the peace , no doubt . But peace at the price of his life ? There were rumors about the Princess , her father was an old man after all and her mother one of the cave people . They were not exactly renowned for their beauty and gentle souls . <newline> His concerns were washed away when her father unveiled her before the altar . She was a stunning woman with eyes in a green Aldwyn had never seen before and hair in fiery red . When her lips curled to a timid smile Aldwyn fell in love . The next three days went by in a haze . He barely slept , but he did not mind . Drunk from the wine in his cup and the woman on his lap the young Emperor danced and feasted and dined like had had not since his own father fell at the sacking of Oldtown . He swore to himself he would one day be a better father , unlike the fool that raised him . And now he had the wife who would carry his beatiful offspring , future empires of not only the Lowlands , the Shire and the moors but also the Mountains Peak and the Narrow Land . He wondered what he would name them , as their names would go down in history for eternity . <newline> <newline> But as the third day went Aldwyns lust grew . Winifred had teased him since he carried her down the stairs of the cathedral and soon he would take what was rightfully his . He grabbed her arm and pulled her close to his face . Accidentally tainting her white dress with his wine colored saliva he whispered in her ear and the two went off to his quarters . He ripped her dress in two as the door closed behind him , pushing her onto the bed . He needed this and he would take it now . <newline> As he pinned her down a thought arose in his head . This was not some whore he had picked up in an alley , fearing for her life as she complied , this was his wife . <newline> <newline> He froze for a moment , searching for something romantic to say . `` You 're not as ugly as the rumors say '' , he spat out . She seemed unimpressed . He pulled himself off her and in a moment of poetic clearness he muttered : `` You are the stars on my sky , lighting the way home . '' Caressing her face he went for a kiss and was greeted by the point of a dagger penetrating his ribs . <newline> `` Even with all the stars on the sky , the night will always remain dark . `` , she whispered in his ear . She waited for the blood to dripple out of his mouth , then shoved the Emperors lifeless body off herself . The assassin covered herself with a cloak laying near the bed and held for a moment . She had all the time in the world , her husband was not expected for another hour and with the feast going on she would have no trouble escaping . <newline> What a fool she thought to herself as she climbed past the windowframe . He was right in one way though , Princess Winifred truly is as ugly as the rumors say .

prompt: Even with all the stars on the sky , the night will always remain dark .
story:
The night sky was a canvas of twinkling stars, a celestial showcase of light and wonder. The world below seemed to fade into insignificance as the stars shone bright, a reminder of the infinite vastness that lay beyond human comprehension. Yet, as I stood there, gazing up at the starry expanse, I couldn't shake the feeling that the night would always remain dark.

It was a feeling that had been with me since childhood, a nagging sense that no matter how many stars shone bright, the darkness would always be there, lurking just beneath the surface. My grandmother used to tell me that the stars were like diamonds scattered across the velvet blackness of space, but I never quite believed her. To me, the stars were just a reminder of the darkness that lay just beyond the reach of their light.

As I grew older, the feeling only intensified. I began to see the world as a battleground between light and darkness, with the stars representing the latter. The darkness was a palpable force, a living, breathing entity that seeped into every corner of my existence. It was the shadow that fell across my face when I walked alone at night, the silence that filled the room when the lights were turned off, and the emptiness that seemed to swallow me whole when I was alone.

One night, I decided to take a walk in the woods, to see if the darkness would reveal its secrets to me. The stars above twinkled and shone, but as I walked deeper into the forest, the light began to fade. The trees loomed above me, casting long, ominous shadows on the ground. I felt the darkness closing in around me, a suffocating blanket that threatened to consume me whole.

And then, I saw it. A figure standing just beyond the treeline, watching me with eyes that glowed like embers in the dark. I froze, my heart pounding in my chest, as the figure began to move towards me. The stars above seemed to fade into insignificance as the darkness closed in, a living, breathing entity that seemed to pulse with a malevolent life of its own.

As the figure drew closer, I realized that it was not a monster or a ghost, but a reflection of my own fears and doubts. The darkness was not something external, but something internal, a manifestation of the shadows that lurked within my own mind. The stars above twinkled and shone, but they were just a reminder of the light that lay within me, waiting to be unleashed.

In that moment, I understood that the night would always remain dark, but it was not because of the stars or the darkness. It was because of the choices we make, the fears we harbor, and the shadows we create within ourselves. The stars were just a reminder of the light that lay within, waiting to be set free. And as I stood there, frozen in the darkness, I knew that I had the power to choose, to let the light shine bright, and to banish the shadows that had haunted me for so long.

prompt: You dress up as the `` classic '' reaper for a Halloween party -- black robe , toy scythe , all that jazz . Midway through the night , you hear a deep , dark voice in your head ... `` I need a sick day , man , and you look like the perfect person to take my place ... Your costume is almost perfect , after all . ''
story: Death waits for no man . That 's another way of saying the vacation package was absolute shit and the dental plan left a lot to be desired . Thankfully he was able to get his shift covered and take some well deserved time off during Halloween , he did n't even have to buy a costume . He knocked on Tom 's door with a big grin on his face , which was entirely coincidental but this time his skeletal visage *meant* it . Amanda let him in with a wave of her hand . <newline> <newline> `` Tom 's in the drawing room . May I get you two something to drink ? '' <newline> <newline> `` ... ... ... .. '' <newline> <newline> `` Oh . Uh , well I 'll just grab a coffee for Tom shall I ? '' <newline> <newline> Death passed silently into the drawing room , where an overweight business intelligence consultant was pouring over scrolls crossed out with red pen . <newline> <newline> `` Should n't have survived Woodstock . Has literally no immune system . Professional ninety-year-old basejumper *oh COME ON . * You 're here , good , take a seat . Seven failed suicide attempts despite trying her best ... <newline> <newline> Death hovered uncertainly at the door until Tom 's impatient waving brought him down to a wicker deckchair . Eventually the style pen was thrown against a litany of crossed names and corrections . Tom 's eyes met the hollow pools of darkness that seemed angled slightly downwards towards the floor . <newline> <newline> `` Cinco de mayo . Explain . '' <newline> <newline> `` ... ... .. '' <newline> <newline> `` Right well I 'll tell you what it is . It 's a bloody *disgrace* is what it is . Talking to the departed ? Welcoming home the ghosts of your ancestors ? As in , what are you even *for ? * '' <newline> <newline> Death stared without comment . <newline> <newline> `` In the past two hundred years everyone 's life expectancy has been booming out of control and you do n't even have the common decency to put a stop to it . I saw a lady who was a hundred and twenty ! A hundred and *twenty ! * I had to personally apologize for the delay and might I say she was *not* happy to see me . '' <newline> <newline> Tom shuffled the papers and dumped them onto Death 's lap . <newline> <newline> `` I 've prepared your itinerary for the following year . The whole world should have entered a global warming ice age three years ago and we have a *lot* of catching up to do if we 're going to make the antibiotics shortage before June . '' <newline> <newline> `` ... ... ... . '' <newline> <newline> Death grinned .

prompt: You dress up as the `` classic '' reaper for a Halloween party -- black robe , toy scythe , all that jazz . Midway through the night , you hear a deep , dark voice in your head ... `` I need a sick day , man , and you look like the perfect person to take my place ... Your costume is almost perfect , after all . ''
story:
I adjusted my black robe, making sure the hood was securely in place. The toy scythe in my hand felt reassuringly heavy, a prop that would complete my classic reaper costume. I had spent hours perfecting the look, from the tattered edges of the robe to the painted-on skull on my face. I was ready to take on the night as the embodiment of mortality itself.

As I mingled with the other partygoers, I couldn't help but feel a sense of pride in my costume. I was the epitome of Halloween spirit, a harbinger of doom and destruction. But as the night wore on, I began to feel a creeping sense of unease. It started as a whisper in the back of my mind, a gentle nudge that I couldn't quite ignore.

At first, I thought it was just the music or the laughter of the other guests, but then I heard it again - a deep, dark voice that seemed to come from nowhere and everywhere at the same time. "I need a sick day, man," it said, "and you look like the perfect person to take my place."

I spun around, trying to locate the source of the voice, but there was no one in sight. The voice seemed to be coming from inside my head, echoing off the walls of my skull. I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that I was not alone.

The voice spoke again, its tone dripping with malice. "Your costume is almost perfect, after all. You're the perfect vessel for me to take over."

I tried to shake off the feeling of unease, telling myself it was just a prank or a hallucination. But the voice persisted, its words seeping deeper into my mind like a cold, dark mist.

Suddenly, I felt a surge of energy course through my body. My heart began to pound in my chest, and my vision started to blur. I stumbled backwards, my scythe slipping from my grasp. The room around me began to distort and twist, like a funhouse mirror reflecting my deepest fears.

I tried to scream, but my voice was frozen in my throat. The voice in my head laughed, a sound that was both familiar and yet completely alien. I felt myself being pulled towards it, like a moth to a flame.

And then, everything went black.

When I came to, I was lying on the floor, my head throbbing with pain. The room was quiet, the music and laughter of the party long gone. I stumbled to my feet, my scythe still clutched in my hand. But as I looked down at it, I realized that something was off. The toy scythe seemed...different. The paint on the handle seemed to be smeared, and the blade seemed to be...twitching.

I looked up, and that's when I saw it. The voice in my head was speaking again, its words echoing off the walls of my mind. "You're mine now," it said, "and you'll never be the same again."

prompt: Over night , 90 % of the world 's population has dropped dead . In the following weeks , the survivors , who come from diverse countries , ethnicities , religious beliefs and lifestyles realize that they all share a single , peculiar trait ...
story: He was typing in a room . it had to be weeks since he heard the news of annihilation . From those that were still alive that is . This man in his mid 20 's was in a high rise apartment , a college student that you would likely know . The guy who threw the best parties , kind of dumb . Pretty average as a man scraping by in life could honestly be . An underachiever would be the hugest understatement His lisp , though held a subtlety , gave him a distinguished accent that made him sound more profound than he really was . This only added to his own charisma . Outside of parties , he stuck with friends , had some beers , and did a clockwork of '' eating , going to classes , having an obligatory 3PM cocktail right back in his dorm , , then a few of his dumb classes that he could actually pass . Afterwards , he 'd be crashing the town with his buds , getting hammered until finally passing out back in the dorm . Much of this was barely remembered , but rose-tinted eyes made the studying and maintaining a slightly average GPA worth it . <newline> <newline> The first week of the disappearance , he was in pure denial . He tried the motions of what he usually done through the day alone , minus the school . You see , where he sucked at school , he did better at at street skills . Picking locks , and being able to take whatever he needed or pleased , or inventing something.He mainly stays in his room . Power has n't gone off and Northern winters were especially cruel . <newline> <newline> By Day 4 , the Student grew curious and tired of the corpse smell he could n't fix with his Old Spice . He wanted to know how many have died , if it was something isolated . He pops right over the parking garage 's pole , jogs to his car , and busts it out to peruse around the city . All he could see for miles as he drove along the place were decaying bodies . Much of them stunk like the pits , worse than any skunk he had smelled in his life . There was some jams , which left a huge chunk of the Motor City , the business district , unable to be parsed through . <newline> <newline> He says to himself . `` I ai n't takin ' any chances . '' <newline> <newline> As dusk overcame the horizon , he thrusts the car into high gear , burning rubber towards some grub . He burst into a high scale restaurant , something he could never afford at his wealth . He moves all the corpses by hand , lined the bodies cleanly alongside each other outside . Any of them he had to cut up , to his own disgust , for the sake of convenience , were all taken into a place across the street , and kept with their bodies . Then he went back to his car , got the luggage case of his clothes and essentials , and rolls it right in there . <newline> <newline> Once he had washed up and gotten sanitized , he peruses through the kitchen . Until finally , he stumbles over the cookbook . He sat down with his laptop , opens up a YouTube video teaching him how to cook the food , and to his satisfaction , the food was phenomenal The food was the most he had eaten in a month , but to him , it felt like temporary paradise . He turns on the laptop and gets his few external drivers set up for his own media center , then binged watching a few movies , and Archer . <newline> <newline> Outside , the winds howled around all the skyscraper . The blizzard 's breeze grew harder and nastier than the night before . It gotten frostier , and the snowstorm slammed on right through . Effectively snowing himself into the high scale joint . The bodies , all aligned where they had taken their final steps , driving into poles , buildings or even plowing into people *and '' buildings , were completely neutralized . <newline> <newline> He decides to stay fore the night . Thoughts of those he had lost were no longer able to deny . Things like parents , siblings , even the extended family that constantly annoyed him during parties and other holidays lingered in his head . Were they all dead as well ? He wanted to keep his mind open , but it just did n't matter . He knew for certain they were all gone . He thought it would tick him off more than anything else , as the grief itself was shoved down to keep himself alive . <newline> <newline> But strangely ? It had not . <newline> <newline> Still , the Student knew they were more worthy than him to be alive . He told himself that he was a loser , a nobody . Through days of contemplation , he just threw parties , screwed up and got drunk , while the others did much more . He had friends . Yet , deep into his own psyche , he was n't sure if they really even cared an iota about him . And if they did , well , they were dead . `` ... and dead men tell no tales . '' <newline> <newline> `` Damn it . '' <newline> <newline> The Student had n't a clue of why he survived . He knew they would have perspective or a viewpoint that would help them . But now everything he had said , or done could n't and more importantly , would n't be atoned for any longer . <newline> <newline> A week ago , the internet had went out . He had dwindled through the supplies , and went to raid the locals Whole Food for as many cans as he could fit in his van , in boxes . Rice , fruit , meat in boxes of many kinds that could last him through the winter . He drives back to the place . From across , he seen the dead bodies , but sitting there in their positions slowly rotting away . Nightmares he had over the last few nights of them coming alive , friends he had forgotten , compelled him with a few nights of restless behavior . The sight of bulging listless eyes and blueing rotting skin ? It all began to get to him . But what had drawn into his lingering obsession was a corpse or two gazing jealously across the street . It was one of those sorts of restaurants , like a dive bar meets fancy pub , that bordered for much of the middle class visitors their experience of the city . <newline> <newline> He could never afford it , but subsumed onto a diet of ramen , jerky and protein powder he had form home . <newline> <newline> <newline> Those few days back when he dedicated that as its own mausoleum , the Student pulled out the man 's wallet . His name was Jorge Del Toro . From the business cards he held in there , he was an investment banker . The woman across from him was his wife . Both were married for over 30 years He tried prying her arm away from the Galaxy Note 7 to see more , only to remove her index finger and thumb . He sighs and mumbles . As presumed , they were Catholic , but what interested him more was the fact that there were 20 text messages . It saddened him , but stashes it into his left pocket before irreverently rushing across the street . <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> Now , today was Dia de los Muertos . The third week after the end of the world as he knew it . He never cared much about superstitions , gods , religion , or much of what he had termed `` crap '' . Seeing their disapproving gaze forces him to make it a day 's project to cover the window panels . He lined wood across them . While this considerably darkening the inside , as he was heavily conservative of the generator 's oil , power had became dependent on whatever he could pump on a weekly basis into cans . But the other advantage was the rugs the Student hung as tapestries . He supposed to himself that the remaining legs be used as firewood . <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> He takes a look at the wife 's phone and browses through its contacts . Her name was Sandra . and she was a housewife . He deeply sighs , plugs the phone right back into the charging port . Another message dinged through the notifications . He rushed over to the other place and notices the man is gone , and now felt the brush of cold gunmetal pointing directly into the back of his neck . <newline> <newline> He realized he had made a fatal mistake . *Great , I 'm the jock . I 'll be the one who dies first . * <newline> <newline> <newline> `` You wan na taste of my boomstick ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Boomstick ? What are you -- ? <newline> <newline> <newline> She asks . `` Why 'd you have my mother 's phone ? And what 's your name ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> The Student answers . `` Mine 's back at the college apartment . I used this for internet . Scott '' <newline> <newline> <newline> `` How far up , *Scott* ? '' He did n't care to answer . She yells . `` HOW FAR UP -- '' <newline> <newline> <newline> Scott rolls his eyes and points right at the gigantic apartment complex. `` Shit . I 'm like up 39 windows . It smells like death . <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Why are all these bodies gathered here ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> `` It 's not like I tossed them in here . It 's to make where I got stuck at into a decent home . Just put down your gun ... '' <newline> <newline> <newline> The woman noticed one of her mother 's fingers was lopped off . `` Her figner broke off . <newline> <newline> Scott takes away the gun , rips it out of her hands , before de-cocking it and setting its safety . `` It 's just a corpse . I 'm not sorry that reality makes it hard to believe , but the dead are just rotting corpses . We 'll never get back with them or do anything . <newline> <newline> While romantic that 'd you like to think there 's somewhere else . Everyone 's dead and there 's no cause . No damn reason . '' <newline> <newline> He points and aims the gun towards someone entering right through the door . It was a teenage boy , gawky . Thin as a rim and had a look of hipster art nerd , with his thick black rimmed glasses , curly auburn red hair and shaved sides . Both of them could tell he had never used a gun in his life as he was shaking and terrified . <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Drop it . '' <newline> <newline> <newline> He put his gun back on the ground , then backs off to remove his hood . He reaches into his pocket ... <newline> <newline> <newline> She takes the gun from his the Student 's hands and shoots the boy in the knee . he drops to the ground . <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Why the fuck did you do that ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> `` This ... is my boomsticK ! ! ! Shop Smart ... . '' <newline> <newline> <newline> Scott finishes . `` Shop S-Mart ! ! '' <newline> <newline> <newline> The teenager , while upset , broke up with a pile of laughter as all three of them had now been geeking over the apocalypse . Further , it seemed that , whoever they had found , they all shared one thing in common . Once they had patched him up over across at the higher scale restaurant , the woman named Sarah and the teeanger were shocked . <newline> <newline> `` How 'd you ... '' <newline> <newline> <newline> `` So ? What are we gon na do ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> The Student gave both of them a cocky grin . `` Survive and hail to the King , baby . So what 's your name , kid ? Or I 'll call you Annie . '' <newline> <newline> `` Jamal . Not a bad nickname . '' <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Remake 's okay .
